The class uses the `Serializacion` class to retrieve the list of players and then sorts them accordingly to get the top 5 in each category.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/servidor/AppServidor.java\":\"This file appears to be the main class for the server-side application of a game called \\\"UNO\\\". It does not contain any classes, but it has the following functions:\\n\\n`main(String[] args)`: This function sets up the server, starts it, and keeps it running indefinitely.\\n\\nThe file sets up a server instance with a predefined IP address and port, and it uses a `Partida` (Game) model object to represent the game state. The server is then started, and the program waits indefinitely to keep the server running.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/Jugador.java\":\"This file contains a single class `Jugador` (Player) that represents a player in a game. The class has several functions that allow the player to perform various actions related to the game, such as drawing cards, discarding cards, and updating their game statistics.\\n\\n`Jugador`: option.\\n\\n`actualizarRanking(List\\u003cString\\u003e nombres, List\\u003cInteger\\u003e cantidad)`: A function that updates the GUI to display the ranking of players, including their names and the corresponding number of games won or lost.\\n\\n`setInTop()`: A function that sets the GUI window to always be on top of other windows.\",\"/tests/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/PartidaTest.java\":\"This The file does not contain any actual classes or functions, but rather a single method `iniciarPartida()` that creates a new instance of the `Partida` class and potentially adds a player to the game.\\n\\n{`PartidaTest`}: A test class for the `Partida` class.\\n\\n{`iniciarPartida()`}: Creates a new instance of the `Partida` class and potentially adds a player to the game.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/cartas/CartaEspecial.java\":\"`CartaEspecial`: A class that represents a special card in the UNO game, which can be either a \\\"Change Color\\\" or a \\\"Draw 4\\\" card.\\n\\n`jugar(Partida partida)`: A method that handles the logic for playing a special card, which involves either requesting the player to choose a new color or drawing 4 cards and choosing a new color.\\n\\nThis file defines a `CartaEspecial` class that extends the `Carta` class and represents a special card in the UNO game. The class has a `jugar()` method that handles the logic for playing a special card, which can either be a \\\"Change Color\\\" or a \\\"Draw 4\\\" card. The method updates the game state accordingly, such as requesting the player to choose a new color.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/Condicion.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `Condicion` class and two static methods `sePuedeTirar` and `tieneParaTirar`.\\n\\n`Condicion`: This class is used to check if a card can be played on the discard pile based on the color or value of the card.\\n\\n`sePuedeTirar`: This method checks if a given card can be played on the discard pile based on the color or value of the card.\\n\\n`tieneParaTirar`: This method checks if a player has at least one card in their hand that can be played on the discard pile.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/MazoDeRobo.java\":\"This file contains a single class `MazoDeRobo` (Deck of Cards) that represents a deck of cards for the game of Uno. The class has the following functions:\\n\\n`robar()`: Removes a random card from the deck and returns it.\\n\\n`inicializarMazo()`: Initializes the deck with a set of Uno cards, including numeric cards, action cards, and special cards.\\n\\n`sinCartas()`: Checks if the deck is empty and returns `true` if it is.\\n\\nThe file also imports several classes from the `ar.edu.unlu.poo.uno.model.cartas` package, which likely contain the definitions for the different types of Uno cards.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/Contador.java\":\"`Contador`: A class that implements Serializable and provides a method to count the points of a player\\u0027s hand in the UNO game.\\n\\n`contar`: A method that takes a `Mano` object (a player\\u0027s hand) and calculates the total points of the cards in the hand based on their values.\\n\\nThis file contains a single class, `Contador`, which is responsible for counting the points of a player\\u0027s hand in the UNO game. The `contar` method within the `Contador` class takes a `Mano` object (a player\\u0027s hand) and calculates the total points of the cards in the hand based on their values. The file also mentions that this functionality may be used for remote method invocation (RMI) to display the points of players who have lost the game.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/Eventos.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines an enumeration called `Eventos` (Events) that represents various events that can occur during a game of UNO. The enumeration includes the following events:\\n\\n`CARTA_DESCARTE`: Indicates that the view of the discard pile should be updated.\\n`INICIAR_PARTIDA`: Indicates that a new game should be started.\\n`MOSTRAR_MANO`: Indicates that the view of the players\\u0027 hands should be updated.\\n`PEDIR_COLOR`: Indicates that a player is being asked to choose a new color.\\n`NUEVA_PARTIDA`: Indicates that a new game is starting.\\n`CAMBIO_JUGADORES`: Indicates that a player is ready to start the game.\\n`DESAFIO`: Indicates that a player can challenge a +4 card.\\n`PUEDE_DESAFIAR`: Indicates that a player can challenge a +4 card before playing a card.\\n`YA_NO_SE_PUEDE_DESAFIAR`: Indicates that a player can no longer challenge a +4 card.\\n`NO_DIJO_UNO`: Indicates that a player can notify that the previous player did not say \\\"Uno\\\" before playing their second-to-last card.\\n`YA_PASO_UNO`: Indicates that a player has already played their second-to-last card, so no one can notify that they did not say \\\"Uno\\\".\\n`CAMBIO`: Indicates a change in the game state.\\n`SE_APELO_EL_UNO`: Indicates that a player has appealed their \\\"Uno\\\" call.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/TurnoPartida.java\":\"This file contains a single class `TurnoPartida` that manages the turn order of a game with multiple players.\\n\\n`TurnoPartida`: A class that keeps track of the current turn in a game, the number of players, and the direction of play (clockwise or counterclockwise).\\n\\n`turnoActual()`: Returns the current turn number.\\n\\n`seguirTurno()`: Advances the turn to the next player\\u0027s turn.\\n\\n`siguienteTurno()`: Calculates the next player\\u0027s turn based on the current turn and the direction of play.\\n\\n`turnoAnterior()`: Calculates the previous player\\u0027s turn based on the current turn and the direction of play.\",\"/tests/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/RankingTest.java\":\"This file The `jugar` method is responsible for executing the specific action associated with the card, such as changing the direction of play, making the next player draw two cards, or blocking the next player.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/cartas/Color.java\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Additionally, there is a `INVALIDO` constant that likely represents an invalid or unknown color.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/controller/ControladorRanking.java\":\"`ControladorRanking`: This class is responsible for managing the ranking of players in the game, including displaying the top 5 winners and losers.\\n\\n`top5Ganadores()`: This function retrieves the top 5 winning players from the ranking and updates the view with their names and number of wins.\\n\\n`top5Perdedores()`: This function retrieves the top 5 losing players from the ranking and updates the view with their names and number of losses.\\n\\nThis file contains the implementation of the `ControladorRanking` class, which is responsible for managing the ranking of players in the game. The class has two main functions: `top5Ganadores()` and `top5Perdedores()`, which retrieve the top 5 winning and losing players, respectively, and update the view with their information.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/viewer/vista/VistaEleccion.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `VistaEleccion` class, which is responsible for creating the user interface for the game of UNO. views that the player has decided not to challenge the previous player.\\n`esNumero(String valor)`: Checks if a given string represents a number.\\n`tipo(TipoCarta valor, Color c, int pos)`: Returns a serialization.\\n\\n`escribirDatosJugador(String name)`: This method writes a new player\\u0027s data to the player data file.\\n\\n`leerDatosJugador(String name)`: This method reads a player\\u0027s Instead, it defines an enumeration called `TipoCarta` (Card Type) that represents the different types of cards in a game. The enumeration includes the following values:\\n\\n`COMUN`: A common card.\\n`CAMBIO_SENTIDO`: A card that changes the direction of play.\\n`BLOQUEO`: A card that blocks the next player from playing.\\n`MAS_DOS`: A card that requires the next player to draw two cards.\\n`MAS_CUATRO`: A card that requires the next player to draw four cards and change the color.\\n`CAMBIO_COLOR`: A card that allows the player to change the color of play.\\n`VACIA`: An empty card.\\n\\nEach enumeration value has a custom `toString()` method that returns a string representation of the card type.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/viewer/vista/VistaPerfil.java\":\"This file contains a single class `VistaPerfil` that represents the user profile view in a Swing-based application.\\n\\n`VistaPerfil`: A class that represents the user profile view, allowing the user to view and update their profile information, including their username, number of games won, and number of games lost.\\n\\n`agregarListeners()`: A method that sets up the event listeners for the various UI components in the profile view, such as the \\\"Confirm\\\" button and the \\\"New Username\\\" text field.\\n\\n`setInTop()`: A method that sets the profile view window to always be on top of other windows.\\n\\n`actualizarPerfil(String idJugador)`: A method that updates the profile view with the latest information for the specified player ID, including their username, number of games won, and number of games lost.\\n\\n`actualizarNombre(String name)`: A method that updates the username display in the profile view.\\n\\n`actualizarPartidasGanados(String pg)`: A method that updates the number of games won display in the profile view.\\n\\n`actualizarPartidasPerdidos(String pp)`: A method that updates the number of games lost display in the profile view.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/Partida.java\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `Partida` class, which represents a game of Uno. The file also includes several other classes and functions related to the game mechanics and state management.\\n\\n`Partida`: Represents a game of Uno, handling the game logic, player management, and card management.\\n\\n`iniciarPartida()`: Initializes the game by setting up the draw and discard piles, dealing cards to players, and starting the first turn.\\n\\n`bloquear()`: Advances the turn to the next player.\\n\\n`cantJugadoresListos()`: Returns the number of players who have indicated they are ready to start the game.\\n\\n`iniciarTurno()`: Handles the start of a new turn, including checking if the draw pile needs to be reset and if the current player has won the game.\\n\\n`finalizarPartida(Jugador ganador)`: Handles the end of the game, updating the win/loss records for each player and clearing their hands.\\n\\n`estadoPartida()`: Returns a boolean indicating whether all players are ready to start the game.\\n\\n`buscarJugador(String idJugador)`: Finds a player in the game by their ID.\\n\\n`levantarCartaEspecial(int sigTurno)`: Handles a player being required to draw cards, such as when a +2 or +4 card is played.\\n\\n`noDesafia()`: Advances the turn to the next player when a player chooses not to challenge a +4 card.\\n\\n`levantarCarta()`: Allows a player to draw a card from the draw pile.\\n\\n`cambioDeSentido()`: Toggles the direction of play.\\n\\n`desafiadoLevantaCuatroCartas()`: Handles the case where a player is challenged for playing a +4 card illegally.\\n\\n`levantarSeisCartas()`: Handles the case where a player challenges a +4 card legally.\\n\\n`levantarCartas(int cant)`: Handles the case where a +2 card is played, requiring the next player to draw the specified number of cards.\\n\\n`desafio()`: Handles the case where a player challenges a +4 card, determining whether the challenger or the challenged player must draw cards.\\n\\n`agregarJugadorListo()`: Increments the count of ready players and starts the game if all players are ready.\\n\\n`cantJugadores()`: Returns the number of players in the game.\\n\\n`getColorDescarte()`, `getTipoDescarte()`, `getNumeroDescarte()`: Provide information about the current discard pile card.\\n\\n`esTurno(String id)`: Determines whether the specified player is the current player.\\n\\n`getColores(String id)`, `getValores(String id)`, `getValidas(String id)`: Provide information about the cards in a player\\u0027s hand.\\n\\n`tirarCarta(String id, String posCarta, boolean uno)`: Handles a player playing a card from their hand.\\n\\n`elegirColor(Color color, String idj)`: Handles a player choosing a new color after playing a wild card.\\n\\n`quitarJugador(String idJugador)`: Removes a player from the game and restarts the game.\\n\\n`agregarJugador(String id)`: Adds a new player to the game if there is space.\\n\\n`buscarNumeroCarta(int pos, String idJ)`: Finds the numeric value of a card in a player\\u0027s hand.\\n\\n`actualizarJugadoresNoListos()`, `actualizarInicioPartida()`, `pedirColorJugador()`, `actualizarCartaDescarte()`, `actualizarYaNoHayDesafio()`, `actualizarCartasVista()`, `actualizarJugadoresVista()`, `actualizarSeApeloUNO()`, `avisarJugadorPuedeDesafiar()`, `avisarJugadoresNoDijoUNO()`: Various methods to notify observers of changes in the game state.\\n\\n`jugadorPaso()`: Advances the turn to the next player.\\n\\n`noDijoUNO()`: Handles the case where a player fails to say \\\"Uno\\\" when they have one card left.\\n\\n`manoJugadorAnterior()`: Retrieves architecture. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the necessary components and starts the client application.\\n\\nThe file performs the following tasks:\\n1. Prompts the user to select a port for the client to listen on.\\n2. Creates a `ControladorVista` (ViewController) instance.\\n3. Creates a `Cliente` (Client) instance and starts it with the `ControladorVista`.\\n4. Creates a `VistaInicio` (StartView) instance and starts it.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/MazoDeDescarte.java\":\"`MazoDeDescarte`: A class that represents a discard pile of cards in the Uno game.\\n\\n`agregar(Carta nuevaCarta)`: Adds a new card to the discard pile.\\n\\n`ultimaCarta()`: Returns the last card in the discard pile.\\n\\n`anteultimaCarta()`: Returns the second-to-last card in the discard pile.\\n\\nThis file defines a `MazoDeDescarte` class that represents the discard pile of cards in the Uno game. The class has methods to add a new card to the pile, and to retrieve the last and second-to-last cards in the pile.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/viewer/vista/IVista.java\":\"This file defines an interface called `IVista` that provides methods for a user interface in a game of UNO. The interface does not contain any classes, but rather a set of methods that can be implemented by a concrete implementation of the interface. Here are the methods and their summaries:\\n\\n`iniciar()`: Starts the user interface.\\n`esperandoInicio()`: Indicates that the user is waiting for the game to start.\\n`otroJugadorListo()`: Indicates that another player is ready to start the game.\\n`avisoInicio()`: Provides a notification that the game has started.\\n`setDescarte(Color color, TipoCarta valor)`: Sets the discard pile in the game.\\n`pedirCambioColor()`: Requests the user to choose a new color for the game.\\n`mostrarCartasJugador(ArrayList\\u003cColor\\u003e colores, ArrayList\\u003cTipoCarta\\u003e valores, ArrayList\\u003cBoolean\\u003e validos)`: Displays the player\\u0027s cards.\\n`yaSeApelo()`: Indicates that a player has already appealed.\\n`marcarNoListo()`: Marks the user as not ready to start the game.\\n`marcarListo()`: Marks the user as ready to start the game.\\n`seCambioElColor()`: Indicates that the color in the game has changed.\\n`cantJugadoresListos()`: Returns the number of players who are ready to start the game.\\n`cantJugadoresTotal()`: Returns the total number of players in the game.\\n`yaLevanto()`: Indicates that a player has drawn a card.\\n`noDesafiar()`: Indicates that a player cannot challenge another player.\\n`decirUNO()`: Indicates that a player has said \\\"UNO\\\".\\n`desafiarJugadorAnterior()`: Challenges the previous player.\\n`avisarQueNoDijoUNO()`: Notifies that a player did not say \\\"UNO\\\".\\n`puedeDesafiar()`: Indicates that a player can challenge another player.\\n`pasarTurno()`: Passes the turn to the next player.\\n`mostrarOpcionPasarTurno()`: Displays the option to pass the turn.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/cartas/Carta.java\":\"This file defines an abstract class `Carta` that represents a card in the UNO game. The file also includes two enumerations, `Color` and `TipoCarta`, which are used to represent the color and type of the card, respectively.\\n\\n`Carta`: An abstract class that represents a card in the UNO game, with a color and a type.\\n\\n`valor()`: Returns the type of the card.\\n\\n`color()`: Returns the color of the card.\\n\\n`jugar(Partida partida)`: An abstract method that allows the card to be played in a game, but it always returns `false` in the base implementation.\",\"/src/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/Mano.java\":\"`Mano`: A class that represents a player\\u0027s hand of cards in the game.\\n\\n`entregarCarta(int pos)`: Removes a card from the player\\u0027s hand at the specified position.\\n\\n`recibeCarta(Carta carta)`: Adds a new card to the player\\u0027s hand.\\n\\n`leerCartaMano(int pos)`: Retrieves the card at the specified position in the player\\u0027s hand.\\n\\n`cantCartas()`: Returns the number of cards in the player\\u0027s hand.\\n\\nThis file defines a `Mano` class that represents a player\\u0027s hand of cards in a game. The class provides methods to add, remove, and read cards from the player\\u0027s hand, as well as to get the number of cards in the hand.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a description of the rules and implementation details for the game \\\"UNO\\\". It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides a detailed overview of the game\\u0027s objective, rules, and special cards, as well as the steps required to execute the game using a client-server architecture.\\n\\nThe file describes the following:\\n\\n1. The objective of the game, which is to be the first player to run out of cards in their hand.\\n\\n2. The game rules, including the conditions for playing a card, the penalty for forgetting to say \\\"UNO\\\", and the rules for the special cards (\\\"+2\\\", \\\"Reverse\\\", \\\"Skip\\\", \\\"Change Color\\\", and \\\"+4\\\").\\n\\n3. The execution process, which involves running an instance of the \\\"AppServidor\\\" class on the server and an instance of the \\\"AppCliente\\\" class for each player on the client side, and then entering the player\\u0027s username to start the game.\\n\\n4. A warning about potential issues that may arise if a player disconnects and reconnects with the same client port, and the recommendation to restart the server in such cases.\",\"/tests/ar/edu/unlu/poo/uno/model/MezcladorTest.java\":\"This file contains a test suite for the `Mezclador` class. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a set of test cases to verify the behavior of the `Mezclador` class.\\n\\nThe test suite includes two test cases:\\n\\n`cantCartaslleno()`: Verifies that the `getCantCartas()` method of the `Mezclador` class returns the expected array of card counts.\\n\\n`cantCartas()`: Verifies that the `mezclar()` method of the `Mezclador` class returns a deck of 108 cards.\\n\\nThe file is used to test the functionality of the `Mezclador` class, which is likely responsible for shuffling and managing a deck of cards.\"}"}
